events.event_name: February 2026 meeting of the Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan
events.description: The central bank met to decide on the discount rate and interest rate corridor.

facts.fact_text: The Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan cut its discount rate by 0.25 percentage points to 6.5%.
entities_mentioned: Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan

evidences.evidence_text: The Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan cut its discount rate by 0.25 percentage points to 6.5% at its February 2026 meeting

facts.fact_text: The interest rate corridor was set with a lower limit of 5.5% and an upper limit of 7.5%.
entities_mentioned: Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan

evidences.evidence_text: The decision also adjusted the interest rate corridor accordingly, setting the lower limit at 5.5% and the upper at 7.5%

facts.fact_text: Inflation remains within the 4±2% target range.
entities_mentioned: Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan

evidences.evidence_text: continuing its gradual easing cycle as inflation remains within the 4±2% target range

claims.claim_text: Price pressures are easing and core inflation is close to target.
claims.author: Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan

evidences.evidence_text: The move reflects the central bank’s view that price pressures are easing, with a recent downward trend in inflation and core inflation close to target

claims.claim_text: Inflation risks have not changed significantly.
claims.author: Officials

evidences.evidence_text: Officials noted that inflation risks have not changed significantly

claims.claim_text: The Bank is ready to modify policy if inflation deviates from the baseline outlook.
claims.author: Central Bank of the Republic of Azerbaijan

evidences.evidence_text: emphasizing readiness to modify policy if actual or forecast inflation deviates from its baseline outlook

evidence.evidence_text: signaling policymakers’ intent to maintain adequate liquidity
continuing its gradual easing cycle as inflation remains within the 4±2% target range
external price transmission and domestic cost factors remaining the main variables to watch
